results.title: Work it out (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A video, aimed at young women between the ages of 14-20 years, that examines career opportunities available. The subject areas covered include : Women at Work; Careers Counselling; Equal Opportunity; Personal Development; Industrial relations; Social Studies.

results.title: Word processing: kissing the girls goodbye
results.brief_description: Once upon a time there was a guy called “the boss” - it was a lonely job. He has to get his own coffee, make pone calls, write his own letters and still run his business. So he hire “his girl” or secretary to assist him whilst he ran the business. She was a kind of servant, messenger and scribe. Today there are tens of millions scattered throughout organisations. Studies have found secretaries skills are not being fully utilised but paper processing is exploding. To the rescue comes world processing and re-organising of secretarial duties.

results.title: Wonders sacred and mysterious
results.creator_credit: Marianne Gammon and Reader's Digest Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
Monuments of astonishing beauty and power such as Stonehenge, The Great Pyramids at Giza, Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, Borobudur in Java, St Peter’s Basilica in the Vatican City, and the Taj Mahal in Agra are all supreme examples of the human need to try and explain some of the mysteries of life, and the subject of this fascinating Reader’s Digest documentary.

results.title: Wonders of nature
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
All nature’s miracles evoke a sense of wonder but in some places nature reveals her magnificence in very special ways. Witness the majesty of the following places: The Grand Canyon - Arizona, USA ; The Serengeti - Kenya/Tanzania, Africa ; The Sahara Desert - Niger, West Africa ; Iguazu Falls - Argentina/Brazil, South America ; The Amazon River - Brazil, South America ; Ayers Rock (Uluru) - Australia ; The Himalayas - Nepal, Asia.

results.title: Wonders of man's creations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
When the urge to build conspires with a vision of beauty, man sometimes leaves behind an enduring mark. The following man-made marks are visited in this informative video: The Colosseum (Rome) ; Machu Pichu (Peru, South America) ; The Great Wall (China) ; The Kremlin (Russia) ; Versailles (France) ; The Statue of Liberty (New York city, USA) ; The Eiffel Tower (France) ; Mount Rushmore National Monument and Crazy Horse Monument (South Dakota, USA).

results.title: Wonderful world
results.brief_description: A world tour the easy way. The Swiss Alps, Venice, Florence, Rome, Vienna, Amsterdam , Brussels, the East, Egypt, and Arabia, India, Japan and the Pacific, Africa, Australia, Canada and the USA, South America - songs and dances, the Sphinx, and the Taj Mahal, Notre Dame in Paris , bull fighting in Spain, and St Lawrence sea-way, from London to Penang; The Statue to liberty to Sydney harbour Bridge; and many other famous and exotic places.

results.title: Wonan
results.creator_credit: Jonne Severijin, Netherlands Association for Rehabilitation and Burgwal Films
results.brief_description: One in a thousand people in Holland are handicapped. In rehabilitation centres they learn skills to assist them with day-to-day living but this is a long process. The needs of special home facilities required by the disabled person are discussed with the family so the individual can eventually become independent.
